jobs.title: Cyber Security Consultant
jobs.about_us: Overview We are seeking a senior-level Manager, Risk Advisory Services specializing in Cybersecurity Assurance and Governance to provide strategic advisory support across multiple portfolio companies in the APAC region. This is a bilingual role (Japanese or Korean + English), ideal for a professional who can confidently engage with senior business and technical stakeholders while advising on cybersecurity assurance, risk, and governance matters. The position is fully remote and open to candidates based anywhere, provided they can work partially aligned with APAC hours.
jobs.job_description: Key Responsibilities Lead and oversee cybersecurity assurance assessments across diverse business entities. Advise stakeholders on vulnerability management, incident response, cyber risk management, and assurance frameworks. Review and strengthen cybersecurity controls and policies to align with global standards. Communicate effectively with senior management, providing clear and actionable risk insights. Collaborate closely with global and regional teams to ensure consistent assurance practices.
jobs.job_requirements: Requirements Fluent in Japanese or Korean, with strong English communication skills (spoken and written). Senior Manager level or above, with proven experience in cybersecurity assurance, governance, or advisory roles. Broad understanding of cyber domains, including incident response, risk management, and vulnerability assessment. Excellent stakeholder engagement and reporting skills. Able to work Monday to Friday, with at least 3–4 hours overlap with APAC business hours.

jobs.title: Cybersecurity Engineer
jobs.job_description:
We are seeking a pragmatic and business-oriented Cyber Security Engineer to join our team. This role is ideal for individuals who are straightforward and focused on delivering key data and insights. The position can be based in Singapore, Perth (Australia), or remotely from the Philippines with planned travels to Perth.

Key Responsibilities:
- Implement and manage cyber security measures to protect IT infrastructure
- Provide clear and actionable insights on security risks and data
- Collaborate with teams to ensure robust security practices and compliance
- Oversee cyber security migrations and integrations
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- Strong experience in cyber security with relevant certifications
- Proven track record in cyber security migrations and projects
- Ability to deliver concise, business-oriented solutions and key data
- Direct and effective communication skills

Desirable current location of applicants:
- Hybrid Work Setup: Based in Singapore or Australia
- Remote Work Setup: Based in Philippines as remote work, with occasional planned travels to Perth, Australia

jobs.title: Malvertising Detections Analyst
jobs.about_us: Since our launch in 2013, Confiant has solidified its position as a trailblazer in cybersecurity with our first and only technology that actively blocks bad ads. Our mission? To rid the digital world of malvertising with every bad ad we detect. Our ground-breaking technology makes it easy to identify, block, and replace the intrusive ads that threaten our clients' reputation, revenue, and resources. We've integrated with 100+ major US publishers and ad platforms, and our seasoned security team has developed real-time monitoring systems capable of unearthing even the most sophisticated malvertiser methods.
jobs.job_description: We are looking for a Malvertising Detections Analyst to join our Security Detections Team during night shift hours. In this frontline role, you will monitor and respond to security incidents, analyze emerging threats, and continuously improve our detection systems. It is a mission-critical position and ideal for someone who is curious, precise, and thrives under pressure. Success in any Confiant role requires a commitment to continuous learning, clear and consistent communication, effective cross-team coordination, adaptability in a fast-changing environment, and a strong alignment with Confiant’s values.
job_requirements: 2+ years in Ad Operations or SOC/cybersecurity roles
AdTech knowledge: DSPs, SSPs, publishers, RTB
Cybersecurity knowledge: phishing, social engineering, OSINT
Strong pattern recognition and attention to detail
Excellent written communication; clear with technical and non-technical audiences
Self-starter with strong ownership and integrity
skills: Experience With Javascript Or Scripting Languages (Python, Php, Go)
Familiarity With Ad Ops Or Soc Performance Metrics
hard_skills: Experience With Javascript Or Scripting Languages (Python, Php, Go)
Familiarity With Ad Ops Or Soc Performance Metrics

jobs.title: Cyber Security Specialist
jobs.about_us: At Humiint, we connect ambitious businesses with expert professionals who can help them scale securely. As companies grow, so do the threats they face—and safeguarding systems, data, and operations requires more than just tools. It takes expert eyes, proactive thinking, and a deep understanding of digital risk. We’re expanding our expert network and seeking experienced Fractional Cybersecurity Specialists to support our clients in monitoring vulnerabilities, managing incidents, and strengthening their security posture across cloud, infrastructure, and endpoint environments. This role is ideal for professionals who want to work across multiple industries and help businesses build resilience—without being tied to one full-time employer. This role is perfect for security professionals who enjoy staying one step ahead of threats while working flexibly across industries. If you have experience in vulnerability management, security operations, or threat detection—and want to apply your skills in a fractional, high-trust environment—this is an opportunity to make real impact, remotely.
jobs.job_description:
Your responsibilities may include:
- Monitoring systems, logs, and activity to detect and respond to potential security threats
- Performing vulnerability assessments and coordinating mitigation plans with internal teams
- Assisting with implementation and configuration of security tools (EDR, firewalls, SIEMs, etc.)
- Supporting incident response planning and managing real-time alerts or breaches
- Conducting security audits, policy reviews, and risk assessments across infrastructure and applications
- Collaborating with engineering and IT teams to implement best practices in secure system design
- Keeping up to date with global threat intelligence, emerging attack vectors, and compliance requirements
- Preparing reports for internal stakeholders, clients, or auditors as needed
jobs.job_requirements:
Required qualities may include:
- Proven experience in cybersecurity, SOC analysis, or IT security roles
- Proficiency with threat detection tools, vulnerability scanners, firewalls, and endpoint protection platforms
- Strong knowledge of network security, cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP), and secure system architecture
- Familiarity with frameworks like NIST, ISO 27001, CIS Controls, or SOC 2
- Ability to triage alerts, communicate risks, and document incidents with clarity and speed
- Experience working independently and collaboratively with remote teams
- Relevant certifications
- Experience supporting startups or international teams with limited in-house security resources

jobs.title: Cyber Security Specialist
jobs.about_us: At Halr Tech Group, we specialise in technology-driven recruitment, seamlessly blending innovation with industry expertise. By combining cutting-edge technology with proven recruitment specialists, we identify and secure top-tier talent that traditional agencies often overlook. We are committed to connecting leading companies with the brightest minds in IT, tech, engineering, and sales.
jobs.job_description:
Position Overview: We are seeking a skilled Cybersecurity Analyst specialising in penetration testing and threat analysis. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in identifying vulnerabilities, assessing risks, and implementing effective mitigation strategies. This role involves actively testing systems for weaknesses, analysing potential threats, and recommending security measures to safeguard critical data and assets.

Key Responsibilities:
- Conduct penetration testing to assess the security of networks, systems, and applications.
- Identify, exploit, and document vulnerabilities to demonstrate potential risks.
- Analyse security breaches to understand root causes and develop countermeasures.
- Monitor and assess threat intelligence feeds to stay updated on emerging threats.
- Collaborate with IT teams to implement and verify security patches and configurations.
- Prepare detailed reports of findings, including risk assessments and remediation steps.
- Support incident response efforts by providing insights into attack vectors and threat landscapes.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements:
- Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
- 3+ years of experience in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and threat analysis.
- Proficiency with penetration testing tools such as Metasploit, Nmap, Burp Suite, Wireshark, etc.
- Strong knowledge of network protocols, firewalls, and intrusion detection/prevention systems.
- Experience with scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
- Industry certifications like CEH, OSCP, CISSP, or similar are highly preferred.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
- Excellent communication skills for reporting findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

jobs.title: Cyber Security Consultant
jobs.about_us: At micro1, we’re all about connecting skilled remote professionals with some of the best companies in Silicon Valley. Our mission is to offer a stable, competitive income, along with access to top industry opportunities—all in a flexible work setting with a range of great benefits. We’re here to help you grow in your career. We're proud to work with trusted partners such as Deel, Immutable, O’Gara, and LegalSoft. What We Offer: Healthcare reimbursement Wi-Fi Reimbursement Unlimited Learning: Access to Udemy courses, books, and everything you need to keep growing And So Much More: We’re not just about work—we’re about creating an environment where you’ll love to be!
jobs.job_description: We are seeking a dedicated and proactive Cybersecurity Specialist to join our team. Involves engaging in innovative social engineering testing and cybersecurity strategies, with a focus on evaluating AI systems. Your expertise will play a critical role in safeguarding our information systems and enhancing our cybersecurity protocols. Key Responsibilities: Develop and design prompts to test AI boundaries and security frameworks. Conduct comprehensive tests and analyze responses to ensure data integrity and system security. Evaluate test results for both expected and unexpected outcomes, ensuring thorough analysis and reporting. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance cybersecurity measures based on testing results. Identify vulnerabilities and provide actionable insights to mitigate potential threats. Stay updated with the latest cybersecurity threats and best practices. Document and communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
jobs.job_requirements: Required Skills and Qualifications: Proven experience in cybersecurity and social engineering testing. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with an emphasis on clarity and precision. Ability to work independently in a remote setting and manage multiple tasks efficiently. Proficiency in using cybersecurity tools and methodologies. Up-to-date knowledge of current cybersecurity threats and trends. Experience in designing and executing comprehensive testing plans. Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with AI or large language models. Prior experience in a similar remote working role. Relevant cybersecurity certifications (e.g., CISSP, CEH).

jobs.title: Cyber Security Specialist
jobs.about_us: Recognized around the world this is a bank that prides itself on engaging with the best talent in the market. If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Cyber Security Specialist job.
jobs.job_description: An exciting role is now available with a leading global banking name based in Singapore. This role is for candidates who are keen to sustain and develop their cyber security expertise. Reporting to Team Manager and operating under the mode that your network is always in a state of compromise, your objective is to detect and prevent cyber attacks that would otherwise impact the bank, clients and partners. Responsibilities Perform cyber threat analysis, alert, and report based on intelligence and information gathered Conduct research using multiple data source and provide findings to senior leaders Provide understanding of Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) actors, their motivations, skill sets, tool sets and intent Perform deep inspection of both current and previous environmental indicators for indications of persistent attacker presence Hunt down and respond to targeted threats and intrusions Leverage Big Data to conduct research and analysis Find / develop new threat intelligence, detection, and suggest hardening strategies Identify incidents of significance through fusion of current and historic threat data; determine impact, urgency and audience to whom prevention, detection, mitigation and remediation guidance Apply expertise to ascertain the impact of an attack and develop threat trends to develop mitigation techniques and countermeasures that can prevent future attacks.
jobs.job_requirements: As an experienced and capable professional you should have Requirements Experience in conducting forensic analysis, threat intelligence, adversary hunting, anomaly detection and analysis, and the discovery of previously undiscovered cyber threats or attacks Knowledge in network protocols and operating system structures and hierarchy Knowledgeable with attack techniques, tactics, and procedures Experienced in analysing IDS/IPS, logs, forensic and other common industry tools IT and InfoSec background including cryptography and network/systems/physical security Significant experience with network security monitoring tools Knowledgeable in network based and system level attacks and mitigation methods Disk/network/memory forensic tools, log analysis, and developing custom scripts/functionality Has prepared forensics reports and investigation summaries that includes the reporting of the why, what, how, and when of a cyber attack Ability to analyse and triage malware use static/dynamic techniques, including investigations of botnet and rootkit behaviour.

jobs.title: Information Security and Compliance Specialist - (ZR_20807_JOB)
jobs.about_us: Candidates should be comfortable with Information Security concepts to answer questions that we receive from customers around our security program. We receive several questionnaires per week that include questions around security and privacy. Day-to-day deliverables would be to answer questionnaires using trained knowledge (they would be trained thoroughly by our team + be able to refer to knowledge bases and past questionnaires).
jobs.job_description:
Responsibilities
- Answer questions from customers regarding security program
- Ensure proper data encryption, access controls, and storage policies
- Ensure security policies are understood and followed across departments
- Manage user access permissions, roles, and authentication protocols
- Evaluate and recommend security tools to enhance protection and compliance
- Review vendor security agreements, contracts, and risk assessments
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- Credentials/background - Experience 2-4 years in a Governance, Security, IT Risk, and IT Compliance function.
- Should be familiar with:
  - IT policies & procedures
  - IT Risk and Controls
  - Security frameworks: HITRUST, SOC2, NIST, etc.
  - Vendor Risk Management
  - User Access Reviews
  - Technical security concepts such as: Encryption, Authentication (MFA/SSO), Vulnerability Management, Network Security, Audit Logging and Monitoring, Change Management
- Strong ability to answer questions with clarity and accuracy
- Familiarity with Cloud (AWS)
- Effective communicator
- Independent Contractor

jobs.title: Cybersecurity Architect
jobs.about_us: ExpressVPN is one of the world’s leading providers of online privacy and security services for consumers. Started in 2009, we’ve grown to have millions of active paying customers, a team of more than 700 people worldwide, and a brand recognized by hundreds of millions of people in 18 languages and more than a hundred countries. We see huge growth in our industry, and are gaining market share through strong execution.
jobs.job_description:
As an individual contributor on our Security Team, you’ll have a broad set of responsibilities to support security decisions and architectures across the entire company.

What you’ll do
- Analyze and improve the security posture of all aspect of Employee IT and production environments
- Provide expert-level support in responding to and remediating system and/or network security breaches
- Plan, implement, manage, monitor and upgrade security measures/architectures for the protection of the organization’s data, systems, and networks
- Design, document, and implement complex security controls
- Work with engineers to design and implement automated security auditing and log collection on our cloud-based platforms
- Act as an escalation point for triaging and troubleshooting the most critical security problems
- Ensure that the organization's data and infrastructure are protected by enabling the appropriate security controls
- Plan, create and implement cybersecurity processes and policies
- Support the Security Engineering, Red Team/Pentesting Team, and the SOC by reviewing and continuously improving their processes, procedures, and architectures.
- Support the creation of and help provide training related to various security topics to engineering teams and ExpressVPN employees
- Provide expert insights into existing and new threat models for all IT and production services
jobs.job_requirements:
What you’ll bring
- Expert knowledge of security controls, audits, and configurations related to: Windows, Linux, ChromeOS, and macOS
- Hardening across a variety of operating systems, network equipment, and cloud environments
- Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) solutions such as Carbon Black or Endgame
- TCP/IP, IDS/IPS, firewalls, WAF, and web content filtering
- Cryptography: PGP, SSH, PKI
- AWS, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) concepts, and tooling such as Terraform
- Cloud security for production environments
- Security-related development in languages such as: Python, bash, or Golang
- Threat model methodologies such as STRIDE
